title: 109_hr2320
content: PERMANENT EXTENSION OF 50-PERCENT BONUS DEPRECIATION. The section amends the Internal Revenue Code to define '50-percent bonus depreciation property' and specifies the conditions for eligibility. It also repeals termination dates for 30-percent bonus depreciation. The section repeals termination dates for 30-percent bonus depreciation property acquired after September 10, 2001, under specific conditions outlined in the Internal Revenue Code. Technical amendments were made to section 168(k) of the Internal Revenue Code, including the redesignation of subparagraphs and the removal of specific dates mentioned in clause (i). The subsection heading for section 168(k) was also amended to remove a specific date reference. SEC. 2 amends section 168(k)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code to include long-term contract accounting under the percentage of completion method. SEC. 3 allows an election to increase the minimum tax credit limitation instead of bonus depreciation. The amendment allows corporations to increase the minimum tax credit limitation by an amount equal to the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. The bonus depreciation amount is calculated as 35 percent of the excess aggregate depreciation determined under section 168. The amendment allows corporations to increase the minimum tax credit limitation by an amount equal to the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. This election under subsection 168(k) excludes property placed in service during the taxable year. The credit allowed by this section for any taxable year can be refunded. The amendment allows corporations to increase the minimum tax credit limitation by an amount equal to the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. This election under subsection 168(k) excludes property placed in service during the taxable year and allows the credit to be refunded. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for taxable years ending after December 31, 2004.
